results.title: Asymmetric super-Heston-rough volatility model with Zumbach effect as scaling limit of quadratic Hawkes processes
results.summary: This paper explores Hawkes processes to model rough volatility in asset prices, leading to the super-Heston-rough model. It also shows how Time-reversal asymmetry can be modeled using Quadratic Hawkes processes.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper directly and substantially focuses on "Hawkes processes," which are a fundamental type of point process.

results.title: Explainable AI in Deep Learning-Based Prediction of Solar Storms
results.summary: This paper presents an approach to make a deep learning-based solar storm prediction model interpretable. The model, built on an LSTM network, aims to explain predictions for solar flares and coronal mass ejections.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper deals with predicting solar storms, which are inherently spatio-temporal events, and uses deep learning for this purpose.

results.title: Seeing Clearly, Forgetting Deeply: Revisiting Fine-Tuned Video Generators for Driving Simulation
results.summary: This work investigates the effects of fine-tuning video generation approaches on structured driving datasets. It uncovers a potential trade-off where visual fidelity improves but spatial accuracy in modeling dynamic scenes may be compromised.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses video generation for driving simulation, which inherently involves spatio-temporal data and modeling. The summary mentions "spatial accuracy."

results.title: MuST2-Learn: Multi-view Spatial-Temporal-Type Learning for Heterogeneous Municipal Service Time Estimation
results.summary: This paper proposes MuST2-Learn, a multi-view spatial-temporal-type learning approach for estimating municipal service times. It aims to enhance transparency and resident satisfaction by providing better information on service request resolution.
results.usefulness_reason: The title explicitly includes "Spatial-Temporal-Type Learning," indicating a direct and substantial focus on spatio-temporal aspects.

results.title: Transcranial Photoacoustic Imaging for Human Intracranial Pressure Evaluation
results.summary: This study proposes a multi-wavelength photoacoustic tomography system and method for intracranial pressure assessment. It aims to overcome challenges in transcranial photoacoustic imaging due to signal attenuation by the skull.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper is about medical imaging, which involves spatial data, but the summary does not explicitly mention a strong spatio-temporal focus or modeling.

results.title: Domain-aligned generative downscaling enhances projections of extreme climate events
results.summary: This study proposes a domain-aligned generative downscaling method to enhance projections of extreme climate events. It addresses limitations of global climate models in simulating such events due to insufficient resolution and high computational costs.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper focuses on projecting extreme climate events, which are inherently spatio-temporal phenomena, and uses generative downscaling, implying spatio-temporal modeling.

results.title: Benchmarking Training Paradigms, Dataset Composition, and Model Scaling for Child ASR in ESPnet
results.summary: This paper benchmarks training paradigms, dataset composition, and model scaling for child ASR. It compares flat-start training across multiple datasets and SSL representations, showing SSL representations are biased toward adult speech.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses "dataset composition" and "limited annotated data," which is relevant to the concept of datasets, but not specifically "contextual datasets" as a primary focus.

results.title: A Disease-Centric Vision-Language Foundation Model for Precision Oncology in Kidney Cancer
results.summary: This study developed and validated RenalCLIP, a visual-language foundation model for characterizing, diagnosing, and prognosticating renal masses. It used a large dataset of CT scans from multiple medical centers.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper uses a large dataset of CT scans, making it relevant to the term "dataset," but it doesn't primarily focus on the "contextual" aspect of the dataset.

results.title: Closer to Reality: Practical Semi-Supervised Federated Learning for Foundation Model Adaptation
results.summary: This paper addresses the adaptation of foundation models in privacy-sensitive applications using federated learning. It focuses on practical semi-supervised federated learning to overcome limitations of edge devices like computational resources and scarce labeled data.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses data privacy and edge data in the context of federated learning, which implies a focus on the contextual nature and constraints of datasets.

results.title: Spherical latent space models for social network analysis
results.summary: This article introduces a spherical latent space model for social network analysis, embedding actors on a hypersphere. This geometry facilitates the representation of transitive relationships and community structure, mitigating degeneracy issues.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper focuses on social network analysis, where the data often has inherent contextual relationships, making it relevant to "contextual dataset."

results.title: TinyML Towards Industry 4.0: Resource-Efficient Process Monitoring of a Milling Machine
results.summary: This work presents a complete TinyML flow for resource-efficient process monitoring of a milling machine in Industry 4.0. It covers dataset generation, machine learning model development, and implementation on a microcontroller.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses "dataset generation" for process monitoring, which is relevant to datasets, but not primarily focused on the "contextual" aspect.

results.title: LLM-Based Agents for Competitive Landscape Mapping in Drug Asset Due Diligence
results.summary: This paper describes a competitor-discovery component within an agentic AI system for drug asset due diligence. The AI agent retrieves and extracts attributes for drugs in a competitive landscape, handling fragmented and ontology-mismatched data.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses various data sources for drug asset due diligence, but "survey data" is not explicitly mentioned or a primary focus.
